citation.article-title: Salinivibrio siamensis sp. nov., from fermented fish (pla-ra) in Thailand.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salinivibrio siamensis sp. nov.
Salinivibrio siamensis (si.am.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. siamensis pertaining to Siam, the old name of Thailand, where the strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-endospore-forming, curved rods, 0.4–0.5×2–8 μm.
Forms circular, convex, opaque, cream-coloured colonies (0.9–2.5 mm).
Motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
Growth at pH values of 5–9 (optimally at pH 8), at 10–47 °C (optimally at 37 °C) and in 1–22 % (w/v) NaCl (optimally in 9–10 % NaCl), but no growth in the absence of NaCl.

Positive in tests for catalase, oxidase, hydrolysis of casein, gelatin, starch and l-tyrosine, for nitrate reduction, for the Voges–Proskauer reaction and for activities of arginine decarboxylase, acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, cystine arylamidase, DNase, esterase lipase (C8), N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, leucine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, trypsin and valine arylamidase.

Negative result in tests for the hydrolysis of aesculin and Tween 80, for citrate utilization, for activities of α-chymotrypsin, esterase (C4), α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, lipase (C14), α-mannosidase and urease, for H2S production, for the methyl-red test and for indole formation.

Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, ribose, sucrose, trehalose and d-xylose, but not from l-arabinose, cellobiose, myo-inositol, lactose, melibiose, melezitose, raffinose, rhamnose, salicin or sorbitol.
Utilizes l-alanine, crotonic acid, fumaric acid, glucoric acid, glycine, propionate, pyruvate, sodium glycolate, succinate and d-xylose.

Slight growth in sodium hippurate, but does not utilize l-arginine, l-arabinose, betaine, cellobiose, citric acid, d-fructose, galactose, glucose, p-hydroxybenzoic acid, lactose, sucrose, malonic acid, l-ornithine, sodium benzoate, sodium tartrate or sorbitol.

The type strain is susceptible to ampicillin (10 μg), chloramphenicol (30 μg), nalidixic acid (30 μg), novobiocin (5 μg), rifampicin (30 μg) and tetracycline (30 μg), but resistant to bacitracin (10 U), gentamicin (10 μg), kanamycin (30 μg) and neomycin (30 μg).
Q-8 is the major respiratory lipoquinone.
Major cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0 and C12 : 0.
PE, PG and DPG are the predominant polar lipids.
The type strain, ND1-1T (=JCM 14472T=PCU 301T=TISTR 1810T), was isolated from fermented fish (pla-ra) in Thailand.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 49.0 mol%.
